DDS
Class CacheUsage

java.lang.Object
  DDS.CacheUsage

public final class CacheUsage
extends java.lang.Object

The CacheUsage class represents an enumeration of the possible usages of a CacheBase.

Field Summary
static int _READ_ONLY
          This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as a read only cache.
static int _READ_WRITE
          This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as both a read and a write cache.

          This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as a write only cache.

          A convenience wrapper for the _READ_ONLY option of the CacheUsage enumeration.
static CacheUsage READ_WRITE
          A convenience wrapper for the _READ_WRITE option of the CacheUsage enumeration.
static CacheUsage WRITE_ONLY
          A convenience wrapper for the _WRITE_ONLY option of the CacheUsage enumeration.
 
Method Summary
static CacheUsage from_int(int value)
          Returns the correct CacheUsage object from the specified value or throws a runtime exception is the value is out of range.
 int value()
          This operation returns the value of this CacheUsage, which is either read only mode, write only mode or read and write mode.

Field Detail

_READ_ONLY

public static final int _READ_ONLY
This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as a read only cache. This means that the specific CacheBase can be used to read objects from either DCPS (in case of a Cache) or from the owning Cache (in case of a CacheAccess). The user of the CacheBase may not however create/modify/delete Objects within that specific CacheBase.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

READ_ONLY

public static final CacheUsage READ_ONLY
A convenience wrapper for the _READ_ONLY option of the CacheUsage enumeration.

_WRITE_ONLY

public static final int _WRITE_ONLY
This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as a write only cache. This means that the specific CacheBase can not be used to read objects from either DCPS (in case of a Cache) or from the owning Cache (in case of a CacheAccess). The user of the cache may create/modify/delete Objects however.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE_ONLY

public static final CacheUsage WRITE_ONLY
A convenience wrapper for the _WRITE_ONLY option of the CacheUsage enumeration.

_READ_WRITE

public static final int _READ_WRITE
This option indicates that the specific CacheBase is operating as both a read and a write cache. This means that the specific CacheBase can be used to read objects from either DCPS (in case of a Cache) or from the owning Cache (in case of a CacheAccess). The user of the CacheBase may also create/modify/delete Objects within that specific CacheBase.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

READ_WRITE

public static final CacheUsage READ_WRITE
A convenience wrapper for the _READ_WRITE option of the CacheUsage enumeration.

Method Detail

value

public int value()
This operation returns the value of this CacheUsage, which is either read only mode, write only mode or read and write mode.

Returns:
the value of this CacheUsage.

from_int

public static CacheUsage from_int(int value)
Returns the correct CacheUsage object from the specified value or throws a runtime exception is the value is out of range.

Parameters:
value - The value indicating the type of CacheUsage
Returns:
The correct CacheUsage matching the specified value
